column1: A certain man had a shepherd who had served him faithfully and honestly for many years. One day
column2: as the Shepherd was tending his sheep
column3: he heard a hissing noise in the forest
column4: and wondered what it could he. He went
column6: into the wood in the direction of the sound
column7: to learn what it was. There he saw that the dry grass and leaves had caught fire
column8: and in the middle of a burning circle a Snake was hissing. The Shepherd stopped to see what the Snake would do
column9: for the fire was burning all around it
column10: and the flames approached it nearer and nearer every moment. Then the Snake cried from amid the fire."Oh
column11: Shepherd! for heaven's sake save me from this fire!"The Shepherd stretched out his crook over the flames to the Snake
column12: and the Snake passed along it on to his hand
column13: and from his hand it crawled to his neck
